fields.summary: Eucalyptus ELB returns sporadic 503 responses when instances are registered/deregistered

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Eucalyptus ELB backend failover performance doesn't match AWS ELB

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: As a cloudformation developer, I would like to run several update stack test cases against AWS in the case when the resources created by the original template have been modified.  (for example, terminating instances or changing field values, ideally from each "update" phase).  The goal is to see if AWS errors out or is able to handle these changes.
fields.summary: Determine AWS behavior on stack update when original stack has been modified

comments.body:
Several tests in https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ARCH/Cloudformation+Update+Stack were done to determine behavior in the successful update cases of cloudformation stack update.  (Tests 34-38 were used for this purpose).

Essentially, no checks are done to verify that the stack state prior to update is the same as it was after create was complete.  

More detail about failures can be found in the document linked in this comment.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.3.0-0.25084.394.20160830git660153b.el7}}

*Notes*

Issue has been fixed, however during the verification, when new instances are registered to the ELB, some requests return 503 responses.  This is due to the fix done for EUCA-9965.  On AWS, when instances are registered/deregistered to an ELB, responses always remain 200.

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus VPC multi-cluster cloud.
# Create non-eucalyptus account
# Bundle, upload and register Ubuntu Cloud image. This verification used [Ubuntu 16.04 (Xenial Xerus)|http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/xenial/current/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img].
# Use linked {{cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-multiaz-template.json}} template to create initial stack:
{code}
# euform-create-stack NginxMultiAZStack --template-file cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-multiaz-template.json --parameter ImageId=emi-d978f0ca --parameter KeyName=sales-admin --parameter InstanceType=m1.small --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.b-29.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --region sales-admin@
{code}
# Run UpdateStack using linked {{cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-multiaz-update1-template.json}} template on deployed stack:
{code}
# euform-update-stack NginxMultiAZStack --template-file cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-multiaz-update1-template.json --parameter ImageId=emi-d978f0ca --parameter KeyName=sales-admin --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.b-29.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --region sales-admin@
{code}
# Run UpdateStack using linked {{cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-multiaz-update2-template.json}} template on updated stack:
{code}
# euform-update-stack NginxMultiAZStack --template-file cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-multiaz-update2-template.json --parameter ImageId=emi-d978f0ca --parameter KeyName=sales-admin --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.b-29.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --parameter MinSize=4 --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --region sales-admin@
{code}
# Review stack events to confirm created, deleted and modified resources were noted correctly:
{code}
# euform-describe-stack-events NginxMultiAZStack --region sales-admin@
EVENT	NginxMultiAZStack	c3ff1730-9d24-4683-81c7-6a16b1b34118	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	NginxMultiAZStack	arn:aws:cloudformation::002598321247:stack/NginxMultiAZStack/21665d87-c0bf-4327-b785-a5d0a3711e25	2016-09-13T22:17:36.067Z	UPDATE_COMPLETE
